abstract: European regulators refused Tuesday to approve Google’s $3.1 billion purchase of the Internet advertising company DoubleClick.  Instead they ordered a review of the deal.
snippet: European regulators refused Tuesday to approve Google’s $3.1 billion purchase of the Internet advertising company DoubleClick.  Instead they ordered a review of the deal.
lead_paragraph: PARIS, Nov. 13 — European regulators refused Tuesday to approve Google’s $3.1 billion purchase of the Internet advertising company DoubleClick. They ordered a review of the deal amid opposition from rivals, publishers and consumer groups.

headline.main: Google Hits European Hurdle on DoubleClick Deal
headline.print_headline: Europe Delays Google Deal for DoubleClick

abstract: In what will no doubt be welcome news to the likes of Microsoft and Yahoo, European regulators refused Tuesday to approve Google‘s $3.1 billion purchase of the Internet advertising company DoubleClick. They ordered a review of the deal amid opposition from rivals, publishers and consumer groups.
lead_paragraph: In what will no doubt be welcome news to the likes of Microsoft and Yahoo, European regulators refused Tuesday to approve Google‘s $3.1 billion purchase of the Internet advertising company DoubleClick. They ordered a review of the deal amid opposition from rivals, publishers and consumer groups.

headline.main: Google Hits European Hurdle on DoubleClick Deal
